comments:
This enhancement request is to have the Axis2 Web service runtime supported as another Web service runtime that extends the Web services creation framework in WTP.  That is, a user would be able to use the Web service creation wizard, Web service client wizard, pop-up and Ant task to create and consume Axis2 Web services.  Both Java bottom-up and top-down should be initially supported. Once Axis2 Web services is plugged into the Web services creation framework, the extension specific code would be called for develop, assemble, deploy, install, start and test by the framework.

Additional requirements are:

- wizard controls are defaulted based on Axis2 preference page
- only commonly used controls are exposed, more advanced controls are hidden under sections/buttons or optional pages
- Axis2 code generators reads from and writes to resources in Eclipse workspace directory respecting Web service resource management prferences with no manual refresh necessary.
- If the Web project already contains an existing Axis2 Web service, the services.xml would be merged with the newly generated service.
- Generated artifacts will be organized into an exploded AAR for deployment to server without the need for an explicit builder to build an AAR.
This RFE is subordinate to RFE bug 165664. Targetted to WTP 2.0 M5.

Created an attachment (id=56737)
This attachment contains the initial start up code for the Axis2 integration to WTP with all the necessary jar files that will be needed. The code contains two plugins. (patch 1 & patch 2)

Other than jar files (all are opensource under opensource licenses). The written source code include in this submission is solely authored by myself (Lahiru Sandakith - sandakith@wso2.com). 
I do not have commitership to directly submit this patch. But I am not restricted by any means to contribute to any opensource project.
I am submitting this code for inclusion in future Eclipse releases under the Eclipse Public License.

Thanks

Lahiru Sandakith.

Created an attachment (id=56811)
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.ui

This attachment is identical to attachment 56737 except the phrase "IBM Corporation" in the copyright section is changed to "WSO2".

Created an attachment (id=56823)
org.apache.axis2

This zip file contains the axis2 dependencies to the attached org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.ui plugin and also will be the dependent plugin for future plugins which will be added in the process of integrating Axis2 for WTP 

Please note that all the dependent jars of the patch was removed die to the patch size very large than the attachment size. 

List of dependent JARs
-------------------- 
activation-1.1.jar
annogen-0.1.0.jar
ant-1.6.5.jar
axiom-api-1.2.jar
axiom-dom-1.2.jar
axiom-impl-1.2.jar
axis2-adb-1.1.jar
axis2-adb-codegen-1.1.jar
axis2-codegen-1.1.jar
axis2-java2wsdl-1.1.jar
axis2-kernel-1.1.jar
axis2-saaj-1.1.jar
axis2-tools-1.1.jar
axis2-xmlbeans-1.1.jar
commons-codec-1.3.jar
commons-fileupload-1.1.1.jar
commons-httpclient-3.0.1.jar
commons-io-1.2.jar
commons-logging-1.1.jar
jakarta-httpcore-4.0-alpha2.jar	
neethi-2.0.jar
stax-api-1.0.1.jar
woden-1.0.0M6.jar
wsdl4j-1.6.1.jar
wstx-asl-3.0.1.jar
xalan-2.7.0.jar
xbean-2.2.0.jar
xercesImpl-2.8.1.jar
xml-apis-1.3.03.jar
XmlSchema-1.2.jar
	

Please add then to the directory org.apache.axis2_1.0.0/axis2/WEB-INF/lib after unzipping this patch. 

zipped version of the dependent JARs are hosted at 
http://people.apache.org/~sandakith/wtp/binary/

Thanks 

Lahiru Sandakith.

attaching the complete source of the above binary attachment

(From update of attachment 56823)
seems this missing the .project file which is needed to import as a plugin

Here's a brief log of the testing done with the attachments: I tried with the attachment 56737 and 56823. I used the Import Existing Project into workspace wizard and points to the location where I downloaded the 2 patches. The wizard was only able to recognize org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.ui but was not able to "see" org.apache.axis2. However, when I downloaded Axis2IntegrationWTP-patch2-initialBUScenario.zip from http://people.apache.org/~sandakith/wtp/patches/ and unzip it, I was able to import the org.apache.axis2 plugin from that zip. So it looks like attachment 56823 (the org.apache.axis2 plugin) from bug 168762 is corrupted or missing things (such as .project). I proceed with jst.ws.axis2.creation.ui from attachment 56737 and Axis2IntegrationWTP-patch2-initialBUScenario.zip from http://people.apache.org/~sandakith/wtp/patches/. Both projects compiles clean in this workspace. I then exported the plugins and started up another workspace. I was subsequently able to go through a bottom-up Axis2 wizard. I keep getting the "Resource Out of Sync" when trying to publish to the Tomcat 5.5 server. So here's what I did: 1. Go through bottom-up with Axis2 only up to DEPLOY. 2. Refresh the project. 3. Add the project and start the server manually. After the project is refreshed, I noticed quite a few compile error in the JSPs in the WebContent\axis2-web\include directory. I also got error on services.xml. Here are the errors: Severity and Description Path Resource Location Creation Time Id No start tag (). wp/WebContent/axis2-web/include adminfooter.jsp line 4 1169050534702 129 No start tag (). wp/WebContent/axis2-web/include adminfooter.jsp line 5 1169050534702 130 No start tag (

). wp/WebContent/axis2-web EngageToServiceGroup.jsp line 44 1169050534682 81 No start tag (

). wp/WebContent/axis2-web admin.jsp line 30 1169050534702 109 No start tag (

). wp/WebContent/axis2-web engagingtoanoperation.jsp line 37 1169050534702 111 No start tag (

). wp/WebContent/axis2-web engagingtoaservice.jsp line 40 1169050534702 116 No start tag (). wp/WebContent/axis2-web/include adminfooter.jsp line 2 1169050534702 128 No start tag (). wp/WebContent/axis2-web/include adminfooter.jsp line 1 1169050534702 127 Severity and Description Path Resource Location Creation Time Id The markup in the document following the root element must be well-formed. wp/webservices/Echo/META-INF services.xml line 11 1169050533370 80 Despite the errors, I went ahead and tried invoking the Axis2 Web service in Web project "wp" using the Web Services Explorer on the URL: http://localhost:8080/wp/services/Echo?wsdl I can see the SOAP11, SOAP12 and HTTP Post bindings. I was able to invoke the Echo Web service successfully using the SOAP11 binding. However, I got no respond when trying to invoke the HTTP post binding. Lahiru subsequently submitted attachment 57079 which is supposed to fix the get workspace and Eclipse resource write problem for bottom-up and provide a basic working scenario for top-down. I tried that zip and found that .project files and source files are missing. Lahiru then submitted attachment 57086 (a replacement for attachment 57079) containing the complete axis2.creation.ui and org.apache.axis2 plugin (without JARs in axis2\WEB-INF\lib. I tried importing those plugins and found that I'm getting the error: Package 'org.apache.axis2.extensions.spring.receivers' does not exist in this plug-in org.apache.axis2/META-INF MANIFEST.MF line 148 1169135473479 71 Project org.apache.axis2 is missing required library: 'axis2/WEB-INF/lib/axis2-spring-1.1.jar' org.apache.axis2 Build path 1169135463534 69 I was able to remove the error by adding axis2-spring-1.1.jar to axis2\WEB-INF\lib directory (which is not in the original zipped version of the dependent JARs at http://people.apache.org/~sandakith/wtp/binary/. After exporting the plugins, I tried a bottom-up Axis2 scenario again. This time, I could choose the Axis2 runtime and go all the way to Test. However, when I tried to invoke the service using WSE using the SOAP11 binding, I got the Internal server error (500): SEVERE: Servlet.service() for servlet AxisServlet threw exception Lahiru had mentioned that attachment 57086 is supposed to fix the problem for JSP compile error in the generated code mentioned above, however, when I tried 
attachment 57086, I'm actually getting more errors.  Also, I noticed that the copyright statements in the beginning of Java files still has IBM Corporation in them rather than WSO2.

Lahiru indicated that he will check all the jars and finalize what is needed and not needed for both TD & BU.  This is likely the cause for the problem with bottom-up and top-down scenarios since he had been working with a superset of JARs in his project.

Another thing to point out is after going through bottom-up scenario once, I would get the error "You must select a valid services.xml" if I go through the scenario a second time in the same Web project.  I tried selecting the generated services.xml in the webservices directory but still have the same error.

(From update of attachment 56811)
Attachment 57086 contains the latest code.

(From update of attachment 57079)
Attachment 57086 contains the latest code and binary.

Created an attachment (id=57161)
updated versions of the axis2 plugins

This version contains the updated version of the two plugins in source and exported binary format in distinct folders

Binary plugins 
    * copy the libs to the org.apache.axis2/axis2/WEB-INF/lib
    * then copy the two plugins to the wtp/plugins folder 
    * have a dynamic web project with a servlet runtime
    * invoke the web services wizards

Soource Plugins 
    * import them to the eclipse workspace 
    * two plugin projets will be created
    * copy the libs to the org.apache.axis2/axis2/WEB-INF/lib
    * build it 
    * export it -> create the binary plugins and run as above

--------------------------------------------------------------

Thanks Lahiru for the latest attachment 57161.  I tried both the binary and source plugins and here's what I found.

Here are the list of plugins I need to include (based on what's in the .classpath of org.apache.axis except mail_1.4.jar which I found out that I need to include to avoid a ClassNotFound error at runtime):

activation-1.1.jar
annogen-0.1.0.jar
ant-1.6.5.jar
axiom-api-1.2.jar
axiom-dom-1.2.jar
axiom-impl-1.2.jar
axis2-adb-1.1.jar
axis2-adb-codegen-1.1.jar
axis2-codegen-1.1.jar
axis2-java2wsdl-1.1.jar
axis2-kernel-1.1.jar
axis2-saaj-1.1.jar
axis2-tools-1.1.jar
axis2-xmlbeans-1.1.jar
commons-codec-1.3.jar
commons-fileupload-1.1.1.jar
commons-httpclient-3.0.1.jar
commons-io-1.2.jar
commons-logging-1.1.jar
jakarta-httpcore-4.0-alpha2.jar
mail-1.4.jar
neethi-2.0.jar
stax-api-1.0.1.jar
woden-1.0.0M6.jar
wsdl4j-1.6.1.jar
wstx-asl-3.0.1.jar
xalan-2.7.0.jar
xbean-2.2.0.jar
xercesImpl-2.8.1.jar
xml-apis-1.3.03.jar
XmlSchema-1.2.jar

I am able to create a bottom-up Web service and invoke it using the WSE.  However, if I click Finish on the first page, I got an error message:

You must select a valid services.xml.

It's OK if I click finish after the "Axis2 Web Services Preference Page".

Also, I found that if I deploy ServiceA in ProjA then ServiceB in ProjB, when I deploy ServiceB in ProjB, ServiceA.aar is showing up in the services directory of ProjB together with ServiceB.aar.  So the deployment seems to be accumulative.

As for top-down scenario, I was able to go through the wizard no problem, however, the aar is not generated in services directory and the webservices directory is not generated.  As a result, the Web service cannot be invoked.

Created an attachment (id=57294)
bug fix update version of the plugin

The previous reported issues on BU scenario resolved.

On TD scenario is now can be called. 
Note: the impl skeleton class will be called and it will result the codegen output. tried to get the editor up after the develp phase by giving the nessesary implURLs to the WebServiceInfo class but had no luck. 

Mail-1.4.jar was added to resolve the problem in ws invocation.

Please follow the earlier steps to invoke the BU & TD wizards.

I tried the binary plugins in the latest attachment zip (57294) and found that the problems I reported in comment 14 have been fixed.  Thanks Lahiru!

I am now able to click Finish on the first page choosing Axis2 Web service in bottom-up scenario.  I am able to invoke the Axis2 Web service with the WSE using ?wsdl.  Creating a second bottom-up Axis2 Web service also works (without including the first one).

For top-down scenario on an echo.wsdl, I could go through the wizard and invoke the Web service using the WSE and get back the expected UnsupportedOperationException "Please implement EchoService#hello".  Since the Web project build path is set to build/classes directory by default and Axis2 expects the classes to be in WebContent/WEB-INF/services/EchoService, I was able to work around the problem by copying EchoServiceSkeleton.java from build/classes to WebContent/WEB-INF/services/EchoService manually, restart the server (server tooling indicated a restart is necessary) and try invoking the service again.  I was able to successfully invoke the top-down Axis2 Web service with the user-defined implementation.

I've also tried to set the Web project's Java output directory to WebContent/WEB-INF/services/EchoService, rebuild the project and restart the server.  However, in that case, I got the error:

org.apache.axis2.deployment.DeploymentException: Invalid service META-INF directory not found
	at org.apache.axis2.deployment.repository.util.ArchiveReader.processWSDLs(ArchiveReader.java:255)

I then found out that the JDT had wiped out the original content of the WebContent/WEB-INF/services/EchoService directory (which contains the META-INF directory with services.xml and WSDL file in it) and had used that directory exclusively as the Java output directory.  I had to copy back in the META-INF directory from the webservices directory in order to get the Web service to work.

This brings me to the next question, I noticed that the webservices directory is not generated for bottom-up scenario but is still being generated for top-down scenario.

Since Lahiru indicated he is in working on the client scenario, we would wait until tomorrow before submitting this initial contribution to legal.  Hopefully by then we would have the client scenario working as well.

Created an attachment (id=57484)
updated version of the plugin with basic client scenario

Only the basic client scenario added.

plugin which contails JUnit test cases for the creation util classes

Just want to let you know that Chris submitted the following 3 plugins you contributed to this RFE and attached it to the IPZilla bug 1089 (https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=1089)

- org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.ui
- org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.ui
- org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.test

Note that we also remove the binary plugins, the bin directory and class files from the above 3 plugins. So for future contributions, you don't have to include these anymore (since we could get the binary version through exporting the source plugins).

Please also note that we did not include the org.apache.axis2 plugin because it contains a whole bunch materials that has Apache license (JSPs, MARs, AARs).  If we don't get bug 168765 resolved by WTP 2.0 M5, we would have to ship a stripped down version of the org.apache.axis2 plugin that does not contain any Apache license material and ask the user to download the Apache stuff from Apache directly. 

I've opened bug 172186 for supporting Axis2 Web service client scenario.  Please continue to attach zips to that bug.

The zips contributed by Lahiru on 01/25 was submitted to legal on 01/25.  Legal is still processing them.  We're not sure if we would get the clearance to check the code into the repository in time for WTP 2.0 M5 (02/23).  Even if the axis2.creation.ui and axis2.consumption.ui made it into the repository, it would not be in the M5 build since it would require RFE 168765 so that we have a way to get the Axis2 JARs to call the emitter and to copy the JARs from.  Therefore, we are moving this RFE to WTP 2.0 M6 as well so that it match up to when the user could expect to see the functionality in a driver.
Legal is still processing the contribution, so the code is not in the repository yet.  I'll resolve this RFE once the code is checked into the repository.

CQ IPZilla 1089 has been approved.  Updated contribution for this RFE (to use reflection) is included in attachment 60820 in bug 168765.  It is being evaluated by IP/legal under CQ IPZilla 1373 (https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=1373).
Still waiting on legal approval, targetting for RC0.

The 04/05 code contribution (attachment 63077) has been approved under CQ 1373 (https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=1373).  The following Axis2 plugins has been checked into CVS and released to HEAD as v200704241900:

org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.ui
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.core
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.core
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.ui
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.ui

The org.eclipse.jst.enterprise_ui.feature has been updated to include these Axis2 plugins.

The jst-ws.map and jst-enterprise-component-features.map files have also been updated.
Verified on WTP 2.0 v200704261031 build.
